page.title: 16ECOLOGY
page.content: Many of the footpaths in the area have been fenced in by the local farmers who have taken advantage of E.E.C. grants to fence land that for years was left unfenced. The local council have also left many eye-sores with their policy of demolishing old houses. Most of the land around the village is either forest or heath and there is a lot of wildlife in the area. The rainfall in the area is generally regarded to be the highest in Glamorgan which is a blessing to the anglers as the river is usually deep. The pollution of the river has also ceased since the closure of the mines in the area.
